bill_title: revise the method used to calculate the petition signatures to place initiated measures on the ballot and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the method used to calculate the petition signatures to place initiated measures on the ballot and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 2-1-5 be amended to read: 2-1-5. The total number of votes cast for Governor at the last preceding gubernatorial election, shall for the purposes of this chapter, amending or supplementing the South Dakota Codified Laws, be the basis for determining the number of petitioners required. The total number of registered voters eligible to cast a ballot for Governor in the last preceding gubernatorial election as determined by the secretary of state, shall for the purpose of amending or supplementing the South Dakota Constitution be the basis for determining the number of petitioners required. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. 100 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.161 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
